ygData.subject: Re: flame1.cpp example not working

Dave,

When flame1.cpp updated, will it be posted in the Files section of 
Yahoo Groups or will it be updated in the CVS repository?  Just 
wondering where to look.

Thanks,

Karl




--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "Dave Goodwin" <dgoodwin@c...> wrote:
> 
> Karl, 
> 
> flame1.cpp is out of date, but can be modified fairly easily to 
work.  If I get some free time 
> later today I'll update it.
> 
> Dave
> 
> --- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "kvirgilm" <kvm@c...> wrote:
> > 
> > All,
> > 
> > I have using Cantera to do 1-D flames in python, and would like 
to 
> > use C++ instead.  BurnerFlame does not seem to exist in the C++ 
> > implementation.  Also, it seems that the example flame1.cpp found 
in 
> > examples/cxx/ is not working.  After including the "onedim.h" 
header 
> > file, I get the error messages below.  It seems that Resid1D is 
not 
> > defined.  Does anyone have a working example of a 1-D flame in 
C++?
> > 
> > Thanks,
> > 
> > Karl
> > 
> > 
> > C:\cygwin\home\Administrator\cantera-cvs\examples\cxx\flame1.cpp
> > (36) : error C2664: 'setKinetics' : cannot convert parameter 1 
> > from 'class Cantera::IdealGasMix *' to 'class Cantera::Kinetics &'
> >         A reference that is not to 'const' cannot be bound to a 
non-
> > lvalue
> > C:\cygwin\home\Administrator\cantera-cvs\examples\cxx\flame1.cpp
> > (37) : error C2664: 'setTransport' : cannot convert parameter 1 
> > from 'class Cantera::Transport ** ' to 'class Cantera::Transport 
&'
> >         A reference that is not to 'const' cannot be bound to a 
non-
> > lvalue
> > C:\cygwin\home\Administrator\cantera-cvs\examples\cxx\flame1.cpp
> > (56) : error C2065: 'Resid1D' : undeclared identifier
